newsitem.title: USA: Temporary restraining order issued in Dow-GE case.
newsitem.headline: Temporary restraining order issued in Dow-GE case.

text.p: A judge on Tuesday issued a temporary restraining order against General Electric Co aimed at preventing the company from using alleged trade secrets that Dow Chemical Co says were stolen by GE.

Dow filed suit against GE Tuesday morning in Oakland County Circuit Court in Pontiac, Mich. It is seeking monetary damages and a permanent injunction against GE's use of what Dow says is confidential information on automotive plastics technology.
The order, entered by Oakland County Circuit Judge Edward Sosnick, enjoins GE from engaging in any activity based on Dow's trade secrets or confidential information.

The order also requires GE to return any documents taken from Dow by former employees and restructure the job of Darin Evans, a former Dow employee, to prevent him from using any Dow information. Evans was named as a defendant in the lawsuit,
In addition, GE must refrain from destroying any records concerning 14 employees it hired away from Dow and refrain from new efforts to recruit Dow employees.
Eugene Driker, a Detroit attorney representing Dow, said another hearing was scheduled for April 9 to determine whether the restraining order would be extended.
GE spokesman Bruce Bunch said the company would comply with the order, but added that it "will have no impact on our ongoing plastics business."
GE maintains that Dow's suit is groundless and plans to vigorously defend against it.
